channel.title: Cabal on A fractal spectrum of tales
channel.description: Recent content in Cabal on A fractal spectrum of tales

item.title: Move to ghc 7.8.2 on MacOSX
item.description: Lately I’ve been playing with some functional languages: haskell, lisp (in particular the scheme dialect, see e.g. chicken or racket) and elixir (I very much like it and I really appreciate that it runs on the erlang VM). Each of those has something pretty unique and I believe is very worth learning. I cannot stress how much material you can find both online and in libraries to learn them (except for elixir but its website does a really good job and there will be plenty of books very soon out) and how strong thay can change your way of programming.
